title: Bellator joins Bon Jovi, Taylor Swift, KISS and more on Mohegan Sun Walk of Fame
text:
UNCASVILLE, Conn. – Bellator touts Mohegan Sun Arena as its “East Coast home,” and this past week ahead of another set of back-to-back fights there, the promotion picked up a big accolade.

Bellator is the latest entertainment entity to get a star on Mohegan Sun’s Walk of Fame, which is located just outside the arena on the concourse in Uncasville, Conn.

Tom Cantone, Mohegan Gaming & Entertainment’s senior vice president of entertainment this past Friday presented Bellator president Scott Coker with a star on the Walk of Fame ahead of Bellator 231 at the arena. Bellator became the first sports entity with a star, joining a list of more than 30 musicians and entertainers that includes Bon Jovi, Taylor Swift, Kevin Hart, Bob Seger, Kiss, Brooks & Dunn and Mötley Crüe.

Check out the ceremony highlights in the video above, which included Coker, Chael Sonnen, Royce Gracie, John McCarthy and Jay Glazer, and don’t miss our photo gallery below for a look at the rest of the stars on the Walk of Fame alongside new honoree Bellator.
